instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
board came in dead, Board was missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> was not present.
Triggered <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>, had Pulse on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> went low, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>/3 there was no pulse, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>/5,7 there was pulse on it. I will need some further help here sirâ€¦.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check for pulse on all big coils.
If not detected, check diode mode to ground on corresponding coil.
Also test starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I only had pulse at L7520, L7630 and L7430, there was a stable voltage at L7560, the others there was no pulse at L7320, L7310, L3095 and L7701.
At SMC bypass, only L7560 had 3.3v others there was no signal on them, and there was a very slight fan spin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Tie together pins 5 & 6 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and test the board.
